SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

gov.nasa.gsfc.nisgs.nsls
Class Log

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.gsfc.nisgs.nsls.Log

public class Log
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used by a client of the logging system to log events.

For example: 

 
 Log log = new Log("nisds1.sci.gsfc.nasa.gov",4005,
                   "/home/drl/ncs/tmp-logs");
 .
 .
 .
 try {
   // do something
 } catch (Exception e) {
   log.error(new NSLS.NCS("Station1","Group3","Job7"),
             new NSLS.ProductParameters("Product1","Granule8","Pass5","Type4"),
             "error doing something",e);
 }

          Event source classes must be subclassed from this abstract class.

Constructor Detail

Log

public Log(boolean toStdOut)
Log events will be written to "standard output" as lines of text (if desired).

Parameters:
toStdOut - Whether or not log events are written to "standard output".

Log

public Log(java.io.File logFile)
Log events will be written to a local log file as lines of text.

Parameters:
logFile - A local log file which will be created if necessary or appended to if it already exists. The size of the log file is not limited.

Log

public Log(java.io.File[] logFiles,
           long maxLogFileSize)
Log events will be written to local log files as lines of text.

Parameters:
logFiles - Local log files which will be created as necessary. New events are always written to the first log file. When the first log file gets too big, it is renamed as the second log file, the second as the third, and so on with the last log file being deleted if necessary. The first log file is then created and written to.
maxLogFileSize - The limit in bytes of a log file.

Log

public Log(java.lang.String logServerHost,
           int logServerPort,
           java.lang.String tmpDir)
Log events will be sent to the NSLS server.

Parameters:
logServerHost - The host on which the NSLS server is running.
logServerPort - The port on which the NSLS server is listening.
tmpDir - A local directory used for the temporary storage of log events in case the NSLS server is unavailable.

setToStdOut

public void setToStdOut(boolean toStdOut)
Sets whether or not log events are written to "standard output" as lines of text.

Parameters:
toStdOut - Whether or not log events are written to "standard output".

setToStdErr

public void setToStdErr(boolean toStdErr)
Parameters:
toStdErr - Whether or not errors are written to "standard error".

setToLogFile

public void setToLogFile(java.io.File logFile)
Sets whether or not log events will be written to a local log file as lines of text.

Parameters:
logFile - A local log file which will be created if necessary or appended to if it already exists. The size of the log file is not limited. If null, logs events are not written to a local log file.

setToLogFile

public void setToLogFile(java.io.File[] logFiles,
                         long maxLogFileSize)
Sets whether or not log events will be written to local log files as lines of text.

Parameters:
logFiles - Local log files which will be created as necessary. New events are always written to the first log file. When the first log file gets too big, it is renamed as the second log file, the second as the third, and so on with the last log file being deleted if necessary. The first log file is then created and written to.
maxLogFileSize - The limit in bytes of a log file.

defaultSource - The source of the event.
